concept.title: Associating the Report with a Related Report for Drill-down

conbody.p: Associated reports are two reports that are related by one more columns that each have the same meaning in the two different reports. The association enables users to quickly drill down from the source report to a target report automatically filtered to the specific set of rows that the user selects in the source report.

The report you are currently working on will be the source report. You need to specify the target report and which field(s) in the source report relate to which field(s) in the target report. You may have any number of target reports.

ol.li:
In the Report Wizard, click the Associations tab and then click the Add an Association button as shown in Figure 4-39 below.
Figure 4-39: Add an Associated Report

Click the dropdown arrow under the label "Select the associated report".
A list of all other reports that you have read access to in the system is displayed, except the report that is currently in progress.
Select the specific report that you want to associate with the current report. Figure 4-40: Specify Report for Association - NEED NEW SCREENSHOT

Click the dropdown arrow next to the field with the text “fields from the report data source" and then click on the specific field you want to be the related field in the source report.
Figure 4-41: Specify Related Field in the Source Report

Click the dropdown arrow next to the field with the text “fields from the associated report" and
then click on the field you want as the related field in the source report.
Figure 4-42: Specify Related Field in the Source Report

Click the Add Fields button.
You may repeat Steps 5-6 to add additional relations between the reports.
Figure 4-43: Add Additional Relations between Reports
To remove incorrect associations, select fields in the report that you want to remove and click the Remove Fields button.
Figure 4-44: Add Association to Report
When you are finished, click Save or choose one of the following Save Options: Save and close, Save run and retain (for report history), or Save and run once (no history).
